concise_definition: n. 阵雨, 淋浴; v. 使下阵雨, 给予大量

definitions.explanation_en: A short period of rain that is heavy but brief, often covering a limited area.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指短暂而强烈的降雨，通常只覆盖较小区域。
definitions.example_en: We got caught in a sudden shower on our way to the park.
definitions.example_cn: 我们在去公园的路上突然遭遇了一场阵雨。

definitions.explanation_en: A bath in which water is sprayed over the body from overhead nozzles, typically for personal hygiene.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过头顶喷头喷洒水流来清洁身体的沐浴方式，常用于个人卫生。
definitions.example_en: I take a quick shower every morning before work.
definitions.example_cn: 我每天早上上班前都洗个快速淋浴。

definitions.explanation_en: A large number of things falling or given rapidly and abundantly, often metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指大量事物迅速而密集地落下或给予，常用于比喻意义。
definitions.example_en: The bride received a shower of gifts from her guests.
definitions.example_cn: 新娘收到了宾客们送来的大量礼物。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause rain to fall in short, heavy bursts over an area.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某地区下起短暂而强烈的阵雨。
definitions.example_en: The clouds began to shower throughout the afternoon.
definitions.example_cn: 下午时分，云层开始下起阵雨。

definitions.explanation_en: To give or bestow something in large quantities, often as a gesture of generosity or celebration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指大量给予或赠予某物，常作为慷慨或庆祝的表示。
definitions.example_en: They showered their daughter with praise after her graduation.
definitions.example_cn: 女儿毕业之后，他们给予了她大量的赞扬。

comparison.analysis: “Rain” (雨) 是一个泛指所有形式降水的总称，可以是持续的细雨、中雨或暴雨，不强调时间长短或强度。而 “shower” 特指短暂、突然、强度较大的阵雨，具有更强的瞬时性和局部性。
“Spray” (喷雾) 指细小液滴以分散状态喷出，通常用于人工或机械方式，如喷雾器、香水等。它不涉及自然天气现象，也不强调密集或大量。而 “shower” 可以是自然降雨，也可以是比喻性的大量给予，语义范围更广、更生动。
“Downpour” (倾盆大雨) 指非常猛烈、持续时间较长的暴雨，强调雨量极大和破坏性。而 “shower” 虽然可能很强烈，但持续时间短，通常不造成严重积水或灾害，语义强度较轻。
